about.title: About
about.description: I am young, enthusiastic, and have an active lifestyle.  I am never afraid to take on new and exciting challenges, and I am always willing to learn new knowledge. Because of my good analytical thinking, I am capable of solving different problems fast and efficiently. I am searching for a position in software development to put my knowledge from University to test and to start with my career. I am an extremely conscientious and good team player.

items.name: University of Tartu
items.lead: Faculty of Science and Technology, Institute of Computer Science, Computer Science
items.description: Studying software development at the University of Tartu has given me an extensive overview of all the different roles in software development. Different courses took us deep into all kinds of processes that occur in that field. The curriculum gave me a strong theoretical background and practical experience from writing functional requirements to testing software.

items.name: Rocca al Mare Kool
items.description: I attended Rocca al Mare school from eighth grade to the end of high school. Studying in high school, which emphasized science, gave me strong math and analytical thinking background. Optional courses introduced me to software development, and I decided to study it at university.

items.name: Aruküla Vaba Waldorfkool
items.description: I studied the first seven grades at Aruküla Vaba Waldorfkool. Waldorf education gave me the ability to solve problems creatively and to understand the world around me.

items.name: Noored Koodi
items.description: I was a workshop instructor in a project called Noored Koodi and instructed about 60 workshops. Workshops were aimed at middle school and high school students. I instructed the following workshops: Python programming language, virtual reality, online security, web development, Arduino,  and algorithms. In addition to instructing workshops, I helped to organize two Noored Koodi competitions.

items.name: Nähtamatud Loomad
items.description: I am an IT volunteer at a non-profit called Nähtamatud Loomad and I am developing landing pages and homepages for different campaigns to support Nähtamatud Loomad vision. Since I joined the organization I have worked with the following websites:

items.name: First place at START 2012
items.description: START is a debating competition that is aimed at debaters that have no or little experience and haven't previously participated in any debating competition. The subject of the competition was 'alkoholi kättesaadavuse piiramine on põhjendatud'. We achieved first place at the turnament with team called 'm³'.

items.name: First place at essay contest Kes võidab Euroopa ühtsusest?
items.description: The essay contest was organized by Liberalismi Akadeemia and a member of the European Parlament Urmas Paet. The prize for first place was a tour of the European Parlament in Brussels. The essay is readable at a webpage https://www.liberalism.ee/akadeemia/uudised/kes-voidab-euroopa-uhtsusest/

items.name: Second place at Demosthenese Pärg
items.description: Demosthenese Pärg is speech contest that is held annually in Rocca al Mare School.

items.name: Estonian Defence Forces
items.description: I have attended the Estonian Defence Forces. I served eight months in Kuperjanov infantry battalion.

items.name: I have attended two hackathons
items.description: I have attended two hackathons. The first one was called Arts and hardware and took place in Tartu and the second one was called Future of Mobility and was held in Riga. Both events were organized by Garage48.

items.name: Marathon
items.description: I run my first marathon in 4 hours and 53 minutes.

items.name: Android application Rallikuulekus
items.description: Rallikuulekus is my personal Android project that is publicly accessible in Github. The application allows users to create, edit, and save visual rally obedience schemas. Rally obedience is a dog sport based on obedience.
